snippet: There are complaints against 36 priests, many of whom are now dead and none of whom remain in active ministry. Most of the alleged abuses occurred decades ago.
abstract: Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Chicago, following through on pledge by Cardinal Francis E George, releases thousands of internal documents detailing decades of sexual abuse by its priests; there are complaints against 36, many of whom are now dead and none of whom remain in active ministry; nearly all the alleged abuse took place decades ago.

byline.original: By MITCH SMITH and MICHAEL PAULSON
byline.contributor: Mitch Smith reported from Chicago, and Michael Paulson from New York. Laurie Goodstein contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: There are complaints against 36 priests, many of whom are now dead and none of whom remain in active ministry. Most of the alleged abuses occurred decades ago.

headline.main: Chicago Archdiocese Offers Sex Abuse Data
headline.print_headline: Chicago Archdiocese Offers Sex Abuse Data

keywords.value: Survivors Network of Those Abused by Priests
keywords.name: organizations
